event.summary: 03/01/1993: The Irish Republican Army (IRA) conducted two mortar attacks against a British security base in Bessbrook, county Armagh. 11 injuries resulted from the attack and no casualties occurred.
event.target1: British Security Base in Northern Ireland
event.weapdetail: Two mortars were fired and exploded outside the station complex.
event.propcomment: At least 90 homes were damaged in the attack and only slight damage was inflicted upon the base.
event.addnotes: The British security base includes the busiest military heliport in Europe, with over 50 helicopter flights a day. At least 90 homes were damaged in the attack, including a Catholic church and community center. 11 injuries and no casualties resulted from the incident.
event.scite1: Ric Clark, “Eleven injured, 100 homes damaged in mortar attack on police station,” United Press International, March 2, 1993.
